general_advisory: As per the extended range forecast of IMD, MC, Bhubaneswar, minimum temperature (night temperature) very likely to be 16-18°C over the district of Coastal Odisha and also in the districts adjoining to Coastal Odisha, 14-16°C in some parts of Interior Odisha and 12-14°C over the remaining parts of Interior Odisha during week-1 (27th December, 2024 to 2nd January, 2025). Normal to above normal Minimum temperature very likely to be expected over the districts of Odisha during that period. Overall Rainfall activity very likely to be normal to below normal over the state during week-1.

advisory: Past weather condition (cloudy and foggy) is favourable for sucking insect attack in groundnut crop so its regular monitoring should be advised.

If attack observed, then at initial stage spraying of Azadiractin or neem-based insecticide 1500 ppm @ 600 ml in 200 liters of water per acre. Use 8 yellow sticky traps per acre. Trichogramma chilonis cards @ 1-2 nos. per acre can also be used at one week interval. Cut the card into 12 pieces at the designated place. For chemical management, apply 40 grams of thiamethozam or 80 grams of Emamectin benzoate per acre in 200 liters of water. As some amount of rain is expected in upcoming two days so farmer should wait some days for irrigation and spraying operations.
Straw can be used as mulching material in vegetable crops to soil maintain moisture as well as soil temperature in field during the winter season.
Regular monitoring against the attack of Diamond back moth in cauliflower should be advised and if possible, farmers should use pheromone trap in the field for this purpose.
If attack observed then spraying of neem oil @ 5 ml or Emamectin Benzoate @ 0.4 g per liter water should be advised after the occurrence of rain.

Farmers should make provision to protect the animal from cold (if possible use jute bag to cover the animal and straw as bedding material) during the winter season and provide clean drinking water to cattle and keep their sheds clean. Don't allow the urine or excreta to deposit around the shed which may lead to flies and make provision to restrict the entry of rainwater into the shed.
Vaccination and deworming should be done to control different harmful diseases and stomach worms.
Proper ventilation is required to provide fresh air and removing gases inside the house.
External heat source is provided to keep the poultry shed warm and dry. Various types and layers of curtains and jute bags are used to insulate the farm.
The drinking water should be maintained at a suitable temperature to promote water intake.
